items.title:
The biggest surprise for most leaders is how much latency their stack is hiding.

When your AI canno...
items.content:
The biggest surprise for most leaders is how much latency their stack is hiding.

When your AI cannot understand a user for 800 to 1200 ms, the conversation breaks.

With voice native systems like ElevenLabs, Scribe speech to text processes audio in under 150 ms.

That means the agent understands the customer almost instantly.

Instant comprehension changes everything.

You get real dialogue, not call center ping pong.

items.title:
If you want to know whether AI investments are working, measure the value chain, not the feature.

E...
items.content:
If you want to know whether AI investments are working, measure the value chain, not the feature.

Example:

Reducing mean time to resolution ‚Üí increases factory uptime ‚Üí increases output ‚Üí increases revenue.

This is how you explain AI value in terms the business understands.

No jargon, only outcomes.

items.content:
The companies leading this shift share one pattern.

They know how to adapt platforms, not individual tools.

The formula is simple: 3 plus 1

1. Define your narrative for the platform, this is the north star for transformation.
2. Measure what you do, and connect metrics directly to value streams.
3. Create a movement, including capability building and governance.
4. The '+1': Prioritize UI/UX, because change sticks only when people pull the technology instead of being pushed into it.

‚Üí They script behaviors for perfect environments

items.content:
Here‚Äôs the mistake most robotics teams make:

‚Üí They script behaviors for perfect environments
‚Üí They optimize for how robots look, not how they work
‚Üí They avoid edge cases instead of embracing them

Hotels are edge cases all day long.

Bathrooms are tight.
Furniture moves daily.
Humans leave obstacles everywhere.

items.title:
But comprehension is only half the story.
The other half is trust.

Humanlike text to speech gives u...
items.content:
But comprehension is only half the story.
The other half is trust.

Humanlike text to speech gives users the one thing chatbots never could: the feeling that the system actually understands them.

This is where support CSAT jumps, call deflection rises, and customers stay on the line instead of requesting a human.

Natural conversation is simply faster than apps, menus, or forms.
items.author: @Ronald_vanLoon
items.summary: Human-like text-to-speech builds trust that chatbots couldn't, improving CSAT and call deflection
items.reasoning: Claims about voice AI benefits for customer service, promotional but substantive

@AndyXAndersen Why would you care to understand how code works, if:

1. Your understanding might sti...
items.content:
@AndyXAndersen Why would you care to understand how code works, if:

1. Your understanding might still be wrong (otherwise, bugs wouldn't exist)

2. Your understanding will likely become wrong in about a week after you understood it correctly the first time

3. You know that no one, including you, will be asked to read and understand this code in the future?

items.title:
We measure this ‚Äúincoherence‚Äù using a bias-variance decomposition of AI errors.

Bias = consistent, ...
items.content:
We measure this ‚Äúincoherence‚Äù using a bias-variance decomposition of AI errors.

Bias = consistent, systematic errors (reliably achieving the wrong goal). 
Variance = inconsistent, unpredictable errors.

We define incoherence as the fraction of error from variance. https://t.co/7sYrO6Z6GD

items.title: A central worry in AI alignment is that advanced AI systems will coherently pursue misaligned goals‚Äî...
items.content:
A central worry in AI alignment is that advanced AI systems will coherently pursue misaligned goals‚Äîthe so-called ‚Äúpaperclip maximizer.‚Äù 

But another possibility is that AI takes unpredictable actions without any consistent objective.

items.title:
What's VERY interesting here

Last few years the European Commission tried to censor speech on socia...
items.content:
What's VERY interesting here

Last few years the European Commission tried to censor speech on social media platforms with the Digital Services Act (DSA)

But it didn't really work, it caused so much outrage on here and elsewhere, thanks to all of you posting about it, that it became super unpopular

So I think the people behind all this thought "okay if we can't censor on EU level, let's just go national"

So now you see the Spanish PM announce they will change the laws to prosecute speech on social media platforms (specifically X), and on the same day French authorities are raiding the Telegram offices

What you see here is a consistent effort to take power over social media and chat channels because they're the dominant places where we exchange thoughts now

Nobody but boomers watch TV anymore which they still partly controlled via state media, so this is their attempt at taking back control

I'm about to put up a music video that I created in a few minutes wi...
items.content:
@nickfloats It's true though. 

I'm about to put up a music video that I created in a few minutes with another service.

items.title: I'm posting honestly about how I feel as I feel it so folks can have a transparent view into how up ...
items.content:
I'm posting honestly about how I feel as I feel it so folks can have a transparent view into how up and down Lyme is

when my energy is good, I may craft some bangers

when my energy is bad, I try my best to stream my raw thoughts here

it's ok if most people don't find such posts interesting

but to current or future sufferers of chronic diseases, I'd like my posts to serve as a source of strength and comfort

we will get back on our feet!

items.summary: Greg Yang (ML researcher) shares personal health journey with Lyme disease, offering transparency about chronic illness challenges.

we will get back on our feet!

items.title:
Refugee Blues

Say this city has ten million souls,
Some are living in mansions, some are living in ...
items.content:
Refugee Blues

Say this city has ten million souls,
Some are living in mansions, some are living in holes:
Yet there's no place for us, my dear, yet there's no place for us.

Once we had a country and we thought it fair,
Look in the atlas and you'll find it there:
We cannot go there now, my dear, we cannot go there now.

In the village churchyard there grows an old yew,
Every spring it blossoms anew:
Old passports can't do that, my dear, old passports can't do that.

The consul banged the table and said,
"If you've got no passport you're officially dead":
But we are still alive, my dear, but we are still alive.

Went to a committee; they offered me a chair;
Asked me politely to return next year:
But where shall we go to-day, my dear, but where shall we go to-day?

Came to a public meeting; the speaker got up and said;
"If we let them in, they will steal our daily bread":
He was talking of you and me, my dear, he was talking of you and me.

Thought I heard the thunder rumbling in the sky;
It was Hitler over Europe, saying, "They must die":
O we were in his mind, my dear, O we were in his mind.

Saw a poodle in a jacket fastened with a pin,
Saw a door opened and a cat let in:
But they weren't German Jews, my dear, but they weren't German Jews.

Went down the harbour and stood upon the quay,
Saw the fish swimming as if they were free:
Only ten feet away, my dear, only ten feet away.

Walked through a wood, saw the birds in the trees;
They had no politicians and sang at their ease:
They weren't the human race, my dear, they weren't the human race.

Dreamed I saw a building with a thousand floors,
A thousand windows and a thousand doors:
Not one of them was ours, my dear, not one of them was ours.

Stood on a great plain in the falling snow;
Ten thousand soldiers marched to and fro:
Looking for you and me, my dear, looking for you and me.

W H Auden
items.author: @tunguz
items.summary: Shares W.H. Auden's poem 'Refugee Blues' about displacement
items.summary_html: Shares W.H. Auden's poem 'Refugee Blues' about displacement

In the village churchyard there grows an old yew,

Every spring it blossoms anew:

Old passports can't do that, my dear, old passports can't do that.

The consul banged the table and said,

"If you've got no passport you're officially dead":

But we are still alive, my dear, but we are still alive.

Asked me politely to return next year:

But where shall we go to-day, my dear, but where shall we go to-day?

"If we let them in, they will steal our daily bread":

He was talking of you and me, my dear, he was talking of you and me.

It was Hitler over Europe, saying, "They must die":

O we were in his mind, my dear, O we were in his mind.

Saw a poodle in a jacket fastened with a pin,

Saw a door opened and a cat let in:

But they weren't German Jews, my dear, but they weren't German Jews.

Saw the fish swimming as if they were free:

Only ten feet away, my dear, only ten feet away.

Walked through a wood, saw the birds in the trees;

They had no politicians and sang at their ease:

They weren't the human race, my dear, they weren't the human race.

Dreamed I saw a building with a thousand floors,

A thousand windows and a thousand doors:

Not one of them was ours, my dear, not one of them was ours.

furniture can cause inflammation!

I have some furniture rentals from CORT and I felt inflammation (...
items.content:
furniture can cause inflammation!

I have some furniture rentals from CORT and I felt inflammation (feels like heat/strain/anxiety) as soon as I sat down in the couch

I went to the CORT showroom to try everything and found a replacement

now i feel calm and cool on my couch

I know this sounds crazy but (at least my current) body be weird like that
